item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 3, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The Fastest Mutexes (545 points | 212 comments)
2. An adult fruit fly brain has been mapped (292 points | 102 comments)
3. In Mexico’s underwater caves, a glimpse of artifacts, fossils and human remains (69 points | 21 comments)
4. Filed: WP Engine Inc. v Automattic Inc. and Matthew Charles Mullenweg [pdf] (56 points | 10 comments)
5. AMD GPU Inference (165 points | 63 comments)
6. John Wheeler saw the tear in reality (172 points | 100 comments)
7. The bunkbed conjecture is false (124 points | 43 comments)
8. A Tour of Hell – Shell scripting Haskell dialect (73 points | 12 comments)
9. Newton's financial misadventures in the South Sea Bubble (2018) (48 points | 21 comments)
10. Hierarchical Navigable Small World: a scalable nearest neighbor search (62 points | 3 comments)
11. Tracking the historical events that lead to the interweaving of knowledge (2021) (16 points | 2 comments)
12. Show HN: RelayBeam – A new way of messaging using Ports (7 points | 1 comment)
13. Meticulous (YC S21) is hiring to eliminate UI tests ( | hide)
14. Hash Ordering and Hyrum's Law (45 points | 12 comments)
15. Keynes on the influence of furniture on love (49 points | 19 comments)

18. Serialization Is the Secret (257 points | 88 comments)
19. WALDO: Whereabouts Ascertainment for Low-Lying Detectable Objects (61 points | 24 comments)

21. Eliminating Intermediate Array Allocations (40 points | 1 comment)
22. Agentic patters from scratch using Groq (78 points | 26 comments)
23. A Trail Gone Cold (113 points | 10 comments)
24. Why TCP needs 3 handshakes (208 points | 68 comments)
25. Show HN: A Demo for a Strategy Game (89 points | 25 comments)
26. How CERN serves 1EB of data via FUSE [video] (230 points | 102 comments)
27. OpenAI completes deal that values company at $157B (172 points | 271 comments)
28. TinyJS – Shorten JavaScript QuerySelect with $ and $$ (59 points | 77 comments)
29. The Soldiers' Philosopher (31 points | 13 comments)
30. In the land of LLMs, can we do better mock data generation? (117 points | 39 comments)
